intro: Dorycnium fulgurans, commonly known as the golden vetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow, pea-like flowers that bloom in summer. The plant produces cylindrical pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and along roadsides. Dorycnium fulgurans is also valued for its nitrogen-fixing ability, which enriches the soil.
